What I like:
I actually enjoy it way more than Stardew Valley. The characters are enjoyable, the gameplay is pretty fun, and I am a HUGE fan of the fantasy-centric themes. I gotten too far into it but I like the story so far. I also very much appreciate the gorgeous art. As an artist myself, I love the bright colours and very creative character and creature designs. I also adore the character customization menu. The different fantasy races are so cool and I get to play as races most other games, even fantasy ones, don't offer! (Angel and elementals are my favourites)
I also like that they give you the option to turn off things like seasonal bosses. They're very annoying but the loot is decent. Oh, and I adore all the different pets you can get!

What I dislike:
The game can be pretty buggy sometimes, and I really dislike the fact you have to actively tend to more than 1 or 2 farms at once. It's stressful and they should be more automated when you're not there. I also think it's weird that characters from way later in the story show up to events. I don't even know who some of these characters are yet, it kind of feels like spoilers. Not a fan.

That's pretty much it. I recommend it for the game itself. If you don't feel right buying it cause of the drama, then simply don't get it. Don't feel guilty if you do want to buy it, though. It's a very fun game and life is short. It's really up to you.

The game is very overwhelming and confusing at times. The dialogue can be shallow and very cheesy. It's almost impossible to play this game without choosing the longer day options, but at that point I don't want to spend 40 real time minutes for a single day to pass in this game.

The combat is kinda clunky as well, and the first slime boss I fought felt uninspired. Just a big enemy with a big health bar. Magic is stiff and feels awkward to use imo.

Some of the art is very stiff, too. Apparently they were reworking character portraits, but that was a WHILE ago I heard that. They've since released new characters with the old art style since, and you can tell which characters were added after release. For example, the character portrait for Liam is so embarrassing, with how stiff it looks and how he just awkwardly hides his hands so the artist can avoid drawing hands. Most of the character portraits have their hands in an awkward pose or outright hidden. This is true for the majority of the male character portraits. 

Also, my personal opinion, some of the winter/fall outfits are HORRENDOUS, like who decided to dress Lucius like that for winter? A lot of the clothing have these weird shines to them, and you can tell a lot of the outfits were an afterthought. Hats and hoodies will outright cover hair as if the hair was the contour of their head, and you end up with bulbous head proportions. Good examples of this are with Iris, KItty, Zaria, Vivi, Kai, and Shang.

I appreciate the effort to try to incorporate such an ambitious project of seasonal clothing, but you end up with really nice looking characters like Miyeon having the oddest winter outfit. Sometimes less is more. 
Also, the game doesn't really give non-romanceable chatacters portraits, they're just sprites, which breaks some immersion because you'll probably forget them.

The landscapes and buildings, however, are very pretty and look amazing. Character customization is great too, and you have a lot of choices with cosmetics and decor that looks really good. It's a very beautiful atmospheric game at times, which makes the character portrait and ugly UI issue stand out so much more. The UI reminds me of a mobile game.

Art aside, having to manage 3 farms all growing their own crops and having their own crafting tables, multiple mines to explore and finish, many fetch quests, and the main story line makes the game a little too overwhelming. No single mechanic feels in depth, and everything is a bit of a surface level system. ADHD nightmare game aha.
